Welcome to RESTful API’s documentation!¶

RESTful API main¶

main.read_root()¶

Root endpoint that returns a welcome message.

Returns:

A JSON message.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()¶

Initialize Redis and FastAPILimiter on application startup.

REST API Repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Deletes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – The user to delete the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The deleted contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays(today: datetime, next_week: datetime, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves contacts with birthdays within the specified date range for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • today (datetime) – The current date.

  • next_week (datetime) – The date one week from today.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays within the specified date range.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None, last_name: str | None, email: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Searches for contacts based on the given criteria for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – The first name to search for.

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – The last name to search for.

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email to search for.

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

REST API Repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Retrieves a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Optional[User]

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (Optional[str]) – The new refresh token, or None to remove the token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API Routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The contact data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

Delete a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

Retrieve a single contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Search for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – The first name to search for.

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – The last name to search for.

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → ContactResponse¶

Update an existing contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact data.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API Routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → UserDb¶

Get the current authenticated user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserDb¶

Update the avatar for the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded file containing the new avatar.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API Routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Confirm a user’s email address using a token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating whether the email is confirmed.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

Authenticate a user and return JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

Refresh JWT tokens using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Request a new email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request email data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the request.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserResponse¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user registration data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user and a detail message.

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API Service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Authentication and authorization service.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Generate a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Generate a new email confirmation token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Generate a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decode a refresh token and extract the email.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User | None¶

Retrieve the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The authenticated user.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Extract email from a token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The token to decode.

Returns:

The email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Hash the provided password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Verify if the provided plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the password matches, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API Service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶

Send an email for email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL for email confirmation.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
